p: An 11‐year‐old male neutered crossbreed dog presented with progressive left forelimb lameness and proprioceptive deficits in the left fore‐ and pelvic limb over 4 weeks. Neurological examination revealed ambulatory proprioceptive ataxia in all four limbs and decreased withdrawal reflex in the left forelimb consistent with a C6‐T2 neurolocalisation.
